question.para: Which packages are needed in Windows before installing Adagio?

answer.para: Adagio is installed, updated, managed and executed using the version control system git. The minimum set of packages to use Adagio are:

listitem.para: msysgit: The windows version of GIT a Fast version control system used to download the latest Adagio version and its command interpreter is used to execute adagio.
Go to the msysgit project page, download the installer (link to a file with extention exe in the left side of the page), execute it in your machine and you have GIT installed.

There are two possible execution modes: a command interpreter (icon with name Git Bash), and a graphical interface (icon with name Git Gui). All Git operations can be done with both interfaces. However, the command interface has a configuration that, when combined with the following packages, creates the ideal setting to use Adagio. For this reason, all the commands to perform operations with Adagio must be executed using the interpreter provided by GIT.
Python: The interpreter of a programming language and its corresponding libraries.

Go to the Python download page. Download the windows installer for version 2.7.2 (do NOT download any version beyond this one) and perform the installation by executing it. Python is ready to be executed in your computer.

But Adagio needs the Python installation directory to be part of the PATH environment variable. If Python is installed in the folder C:\Python27, the string ;C:\Python27 must be appended to the PATH environment variable. See and follow the steps to perform this configuration.

question.para: I got all the required packages. What else is required to run Adagio?

answer.para: Once all the packages described in are installed, you need to install the Adagio toolkit using GIT. This installation can be done either with the GIT Bash interface (see ) or using the graphical interface as described next.
Open the GIT Gui, select the option to clone a remote repository. Type the following URL as Source Location:
Select the name of a folder to be created when installing Adagio.
Proceed with the cloning. After a while a new folder is created in the location you specified containing the toolkit and the graphical interface window is ready to execute any operation.

We need to add the folder bin to the PATH environment variable. If you installed Adagio, for example, in C:\Users\you\Adagio, you need to add the string ;C:\Users\you\Adagio\bin to the PATH variable. See and follow the steps to perform this configuration.

qandaentry.xreflabel: How to add, remove or edit environment variables in Windows

question.para: How to add, remove or edit environment variables in Windows?

listitem.para: Open the file explorer, right click in the computer item and select the Properties option. The System window will appear.
Select the Advanced system settings in the left pane. The System Properties window will appear.
Select the Advanced tab and click on Environment Variables. A new window appears showing the user variables at the top, and the system variables at the bottom.
Click on New... to add a new variable, select one variable and click on Edit... to change its value, or select one variable and delete it by clicking on Delete.
Click the OK button in the Environment Variables window, then on the System Properties window, and then close the system window.
